intro: Anil kirkiana, commonly known as the blue poppy, is a herbaceous plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and has simple, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are borne on long, slender stems and are often clustered in racemes. Anil kirkiana is valued for its ornamental beauty and is cultivated in gardens for its vibrant color and delicate appearance.
